channel.title: Kingsclear First Nation
channel.description:
Kingsclear First Nation is located along the Saint John River, approximately 15 km west of the City of Fredericton, New Brunwsick.
The registered population of the Kingsclear First Nation is approximately 981 members, with 692 members residing on-reserve.

item.title: Employment Opportunity K4
item.description: Kingsclearâ€™s K4 program is looking to hire a full-time ECE trained teacher for the upcoming school year! Click here to view full job listing.

item.title: Job Post: Director of Operations
item.description:
Kingsclear First Nation is seeking a highly motivated individual, with a strong grounding in First Nation culture, a passion for governance structure and the financial success of the community. Supporting the overall operation of the band.

Click here to download application.

item.title: Nominations for Chief and Council
item.description: Nomination day is Thursday, January 7th at 6-9pm and Election Day will be on Thursday, February 18th. Polls will be open from 9am-8pm.

item.title: Summer Student Job Postings
item.description:
PotashCorp is hiring three summer students for 2016. Please note that candidates interested in applying for these positions must visit www.potashcorpjobs.com online to apply. Preference will be given to those applicants who choose to voluntarily self-identify as Aboriginal. Job postings are listed below.

Human Resources Summer Student
Engineering Summer Student
Technician/Technologist Summer Student

item.title: Treaty Education Time Change
item.description:
New Time Change

Attention Community Members: The Treaty Education has changed from Tuesday December 8th, 2015 @ 6pm to Thursday December 10th, 2016 @ 6pm. It will be located at the Bandhall Culture room. Light refreshments and Door prizes.

Woliwon,
Sydney Paul
363-3028 ext. 143
sydneypaul@kingsclear.ca

Treaty Education Time Change
